p: The clinical outcome of dengue infection (1 or 2Â°) in individuals depends on a considerable set of factors both (i) dengue specific, such as dengue immunological status (previous infections, order of infections) [ 105], genetic fitness of the lineages infected [ 147, 149, 150], and (ii) patient specific, such as age, HLA status, and unknown genetics [ 133]. Understanding the factors that determine the clinical outcome of a disease and the correlates of protection are key to the development of effective interventions.
